If the ability to place message bodies in the list of messages existed, users could preview messages by hovering over the message body column.  The message body (or a portion of it) would appear in a balloon (tooltip).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click column selector button.
2. Many options appear but not body.

comments.text:
Created attachment 514382
screenshot - Note that entire subject can be read in tooltip.

This screenshot demonstrates that the user does not need to click on the message to read its subject line.  The user can simply place the mouse cursor over the subject line in the message listing pane.
comments.raw_text: This screenshot demonstrates that the user does not need to click on the message to read its subject line.  The user can simply place the mouse cursor over the subject line in the message listing pane.

Because the user can't choose to include the message body in the message pane listing, the only way to read the message is to click on it.  It's not even possible to preview the message body by simply placing the mouse cursor in a way that would generate a tooltip (aka balloon).

comments.text:
I'm not sure how and how much of HTML message bodies can be displayed in a single-lined body column, but I like the idea of message previews in message list. Showing a tooltip with some extract of the message might be one option. For quick searches involving body, that tooltip could even show the relevant part of the body which has the search words.

You'll need to spell out the details of the desired UI (ideally with mockup screenshots) if you want this to be considered.
